item.title: Sanctions will harm the West—but the fact it is prepared to suffer for them sends the message to Vladimir Putin that it takes his transgressions seriously https://t.co/Rglw47F6iv
The penalties on big Russian banks will make life difficult but not impossible for Russia https://t.co/RiYrJPdbuW
The economic consequences of the war in Ukraine https://t.co/OzcxRvftuj
China wants to insulate itself against Western sanctions https://t.co/OexuStDJGD
For all the support given to Ukraine in the form of money and weapons, America has drawn a clear line between countries that are in NATO and those that remain outside https://t.co/aEgYwsjqtb
We’re following the crisis closely, and our coverage describes what’s at stake and what might happen next. Bookmark this page for our latest analysis https://t.co/VzQaT7eDdS

The Biden administration accurately predicted Putin's bloody invasion of Ukraine and the bogus pretexts he would offer for it months ago. Its effort to preempt and counter Russian disinformation has been excellent. My column: https://t.co/0cJlC7WoeD

Some Ukrainian intelligence officials believed the war would be confined to separatist enclaves in the east of the country. But America and Britain have for months though that Vladimir Putin intended something much larger https://t.co/b2BYX5lp4S
The world must inflict a heavy price for Vladimir Putin’s aggression https://t.co/B6gMuFhQwL

♦️ Volodymyr Zelensky said he believes Russia aims to assassinate him.
♦️ Gunfire was reportedly heard in Kyiv’s government quarter.
♦️ At least 137 Ukrainian soldiers and civilians have been killed. Britain estimates around 450 Russian troops have been killed.

♦️ Several explosions were reported in Kyiv overnight.
♦️ Men aged 18-60 have been prohibited from leaving Ukraine.
♦️ Joe Biden imposed harsh sanctions and export controls on Russia.
Catch up on the latest developments👇

A former bodyguard of Vladimir Putin, and now a commander of the national guard, said: “We don’t have a border with Ukraine. It is America’s border...we must recognise these republics...and move further, to defend our country” https://t.co/AfF5XIRAEn

Vladimir Putin has launched an unprovoked assault on the sovereign country next door. He is obsessed with the defensive alliance to its west. And he is trampling the principles that underpin peace in the 21st century https://t.co/Gd9QFlLJgg
After a day of frenetic consultations among Western leaders, several of Ukraine’s calls for tougher action were left unanswered https://t.co/EoKPutkXyq
Where have Russian attacks taken place in Ukraine? https://t.co/0N0RpkveZ5
History will judge Vladimir Putin harshly for his war https://t.co/6gQbeMMnYC
The West’s response remains far from exhaustive https://t.co/ngSW1nTqKf
There is evidence that Ukrainian forces have slowed the Russian advance in some areas, particularly in the east. But the security situation in Kyiv hangs in the balance https://t.co/HJnZq1Am2Y

Three weeks ago China crucially joined Russia in opposing further expansion of NATO for the first time, buttressing Vladimir Putin’s demand that Ukraine be kept out of the alliance https://t.co/LQoHehEEGu
Banking restrictions will bite Russia immediately, causing a funding crunch and impeding financial flows in and out of the country https://t.co/f7ozSxud7o
China is watching closely how Russia applies hybrid warfare in Ukraine, one observer notes, with lessons for its use against Taiwan https://t.co/NDaye6zG3b

America and Europe seem to hope that opprobrium, economic pressure, the grind of war and, perhaps, discontent at home, will eventually convince Vladimir Putin to pull back—or at least not advance further https://t.co/gYmiFv3qEK
Aviation authorities warn of risks to civilian flights as Russia wages war https://t.co/wS23cqoJfo

This month Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping issued a joint statement that signalled the countries’ strongest ties for 70 years. It held up the two authoritarian powers as the true guarantors of “genuine democracy” https://t.co/P4Vah1dAek

Vladimir Putin cannot tell his people that his army is fighting against their Ukrainian brothers and sisters who gained freedom. So he is telling them that Russia is at war with America, NATO and its proxies https://t.co/wB4o3hGu9x

“This is not just an attack on a sovereign country, it is the future of European security at risk and, frankly, the future of the post-war global order at risk.” @zannymb, The Economist’s editor-in-chief, talks to “The Economist Asks” podcast https://t.co/Jd0Rswf0eK
Russia has tried to peel Turkey away from NATO, while Turkey, estranged from its Western partners, has looked to Russia to advance its regional interests https://t.co/ichxt6SQw7
Those who imagined that sanctions would cripple Russia’s economy overnight are likely to be disappointed, if only because much of the world still wants its oil and gas https://t.co/fgJzvF0Sm2

♦️ Ukraine’s president said 137 Ukrainians—both soldiers and civilians—were killed on the first day.
♦️ Russia launched over 160 missiles, said an American army official.
♦️ A curfew was instituted in Kyiv on Thursday night.
